required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Mass Balance and Biotransformation of [14C]Donafenib in Healthy Adult Man
clinical_study.official_title: The Mass Balance and Biotransformation Study of [14C] Donafenib in Chinese Healthy Adult Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to evaluate the mass balance and biotransformation after single-dose of [14C]Donafenib orally in Chinese healthy adult male volunteers, revealing the overall pharmacokinetic characteristics of Donafenib in humans, and providing a reference for the rational administration.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: single arm with single dose of 300mg Donafenib, containing about 120μCi [14C]Donafenib

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitive analysis of whole radioactivity of excrement of orally administered [14]Donafenib in Chinese healthy adult male volunteers to obtain the mass balance data and the main excretion pathway in human body
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 0 hour to 240 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of radioactive dose of [14C] radiolabelled Donafenib recovered in urine, faeces and in total

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of the main metabolite and biotransformation pathway of Donafenib and investigation of metabolite in plasma by LC-RAM/HRMS
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 0 hour to 240 hours after administration

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitive analysis of the concentrations of Donafenib in plasma using the validated LC-MS/MS to obtain pharmacokinetic data
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 0 hour to 240 hours after administration
primary_outcome.description: The concentrations of Donafenib in plasma

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 days (approx) from the start of administration
secondary_outcome.description: Review the relationship between investigational products and all the abnormal and clinically significant findings

intervention.description: Each volunteers received a single 300 mg dose of [14C]donafenib (toluene sulfonic acid) containing a radioactivity dose of 120 μCi as an oral suspension, in fasting within 5 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A healthy male adult.
- Age is between 18 and 45, inclusive.
- Body mass index is between 19 and 26, inclusive.
- Voluntarily to provide informed consent form.
- Willing and able to communicate with investigators and complete the trial according to clinical trial protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any abnormal and clinical significant findings.
- A positive examination result of HBsAg/HBeAg, HIV antibody and treponema pallidum antibody.
- Volunteers who had participated in a radiolabeled clinical study or were exposed to significant levels of radiation for any reasons within the 12 months prior to the study.
- Volunteers who had used of prescription or herbal products that may affect the drug metabolism within 30 days before the study.
- Volunteers who had blood loss/donation up to 400 mL within 3 months before the screening, or received blood transfusion within 1 month.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Suzhou Medical College

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Suzhou University
